page.title: 04PORTHCAWL-Education
page.content: As with other areas in Great Britain, Porthcawl can boast of excellent educational facilities.They are however all in other corresponding rectangles. The first state education school in Porthcawl was opened in 1873 at the cost of Â£500.It was housed in Lias Road and was called Porthcawl National School.The discipline in the school was very strict,both for staff and pupils.It was originally a church and was therefore built in the shape of a cross.Many people living in Porthcawl remember the imposing building and looking back probably wonder how it turned out such good pupils. The school was eventually closed in 1952 and soon after was demolished.It is now the site of a supermarket.
